alert.note: Alert for Aroostook; Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 15 at 9:36AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of East Central and Northern Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In Northern Maine, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 936 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Patten, Sherman, Island Falls, Bridgewater, Smyrna, Masardis, Mount Chase, Oxbow, Smyrna Mills, Shin Pond, Sherman Station, Dudley Township, Scopan, eastern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Reed Plantation, Linneus, Monticello, Oakfield, Blaine and New Limerick. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
